WorkItem.ClosedComment: The project templates are currently quite limited. We should be improving them in a future release, but as it stands this is where we are for templates and such.
WorkItem.Description: After installing TypeScript i can create a TypeScript project, but i cannot find a TypeScript file template.
WorkItem.Summary: After installing TypeScript i cannot find a TS file template

Comments.Message: TypeScript file should be located under New File (CTRL + N) -> Script section. Did you check script section?

HI,

I have vs2012 and there is no Script section. I could find the ts file template inside the root Visual C#, but not in any of the subcategories: Code, Web etc....

I noticed that the  TypeScript File contains a definition for an ipothetic Shape class. I think it should be just an empty file or maybe two templates: Empty TypeScript File, Demo TypeScript File...

Thanks

I don't have script section at all. All sections I have are: "Visual C#" and "Visual Basic" in the installed. When I look into the "Extensions and updates" the typescript language service is there, so that seems ok.

I uninstalled the extension and installed it again and voila- the Project and file template magically appeared. Thank god it worked- I can start playing with the language without having to run transcompilation manually every time.

Hi

Following this worked for me.

http://blogs.msdn.com/b/timart/archive/2012/10/02/typescript-project-in-visual-studio-2012.aspx
Is typescript file type not available to add in VB web projects? The TypeScript file type I can only find in my c# web app projects.

I have created a little GUI tool for adding TypeScript ability to Windows 8 HTML/JS App projects:

https://github.com/ComFreek/Tsac
